application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [Design, access and heritage statement dated January 2024; 03B; Arboricultural Method Statement (Arbtech AIA 01) by Arbtech Consulting Limited; Arboricultural Site investigation Report (Arbtech TSR 01) by Arbtech Consulting Limited; Tree Survey by Arbtech Consulting Limited dated 21/02/24 and Daylight and Sunlight Assessment dated March 2024 by Herrington Consulting]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - All external materials used in the construction of the development hereby approved shall match the type, texture, tone, colour, size and profile of those used on the existing building and shall be retained permanently. The extension would need to be built to be built from matching bricks and the brickwork should be built in a bond to match the existing house using lime mortar. The pointing should be flush and rag-finished to give a traditional appearance. The roof should be covered in natural slates. The dormers should be clad in lead and all windows shall be timber.
Reason: In the interest of the appearance of the development and to safeguard visual amenity of the conservation area, in accordance with Council policies LP1, LP2 and LP3 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition : 4 - The rooflights hereby approved, shall be of a conservation area specification i.e. in-line and flush within the roof pitch that they would be located.
Reason: In the interests of preserving the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policy LP3 of the Local Plan and Section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 5 - Prior to occupation of the development the windows in the northern elevation at roof floor level of the development shall be obscure-glazed and non-opening (unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed).  The windows shall so be maintained and retained as such. 
Reason: To control overlooking and safeguard the privacy of neighbours in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Wandsworth Local Plan (adopted August 2023) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of the above ground works detailed drawings at a minimum scale of [1:20] (or other scale to be agreed in advance by the local planning authority) of the proposed windows shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority.  The windows should be timber, slimline units, with period appropriate details (including horns), glazing bars should be integral, not externally applied or internal only, trickle vents should be concealed and seals/spacing bars should be white to blend in with the frames.
The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and retained as such.
Reason: To ensure a high quality of development and to accord with policies LP1, LP2, LP3 and LP4 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 7 - The extension permitted shall only be used for ancillary residential use and used only in conjunction with the existing flat to ensure that the space is not used as a separate unit. In accordance with policy LP2 and LP14 of the Local Plan.
Reason: To prevent the introduction of an independent residential use without prior consent by the local planning authority.
Condition : 8 - Prior to commencement of the above groundworks, details of landscaping and treatment of parts of the site not covered by buildings, to include the hard landscaping materials, species of new planting/seeding, and any existing plants/trees to be retained, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. All planting, seeding, and turfing included in the approved details shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance and biodiversity value in the development, in accordance with Council policies LP1, LP2 and LP56 of the Local Plan. The details are required prior to the commencement of works to ensure the landscaping measures are incorporated in the layout and construction of the development.
Condition : 9 - The proposed enhancements to the main building to replace the existing upvc windows with timber sash windows and the replacement roof covering  must be carried out and completed with the extension.
Reason: To ensure that the enhancements proposed are provided to balance the harm of the extension in line with LP3.
Condition : 10 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking, amending or re-enacting that Order), no windows, doors or glazed areas (other than such as may be shown on the approved drawings shall be installed in the approved development.
Reason: To protect the privacy of neighbours and prevent overlooking, in accordance with Council policies LP1 and LP2 (DELETE AS APPROPRIATE) of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 11 - Details of the foundations of the proposed extension, any paving and the proposed retaining wall must be submitted to and approved in writing prior to the commencement of the development. The development must be built in line with the proposed plans and the proposed foundations must not extend beyond the trench investigations set out within the Arboricultural Site Investigation Report dated 30/06/2022 by arbtech.
Reason: To preserve trees and hedges on the site in the interests of visual amenity and the character of the area, in accordance with Council policy LP56 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework. The details are required prior to the commencement of development to ensure the construction works do not harm trees.
Condition : 12 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
Condition : 13 - INFORMATIVE: The owner/applicant is responsible for protecting the upper crowns of neighbouring trees whilst carrying out the construction.
Condition : 14 - INFORMATIVE: You are advised that the Council will not accept pruning of the adjoining council trees for the reasons of blocking light, overhanging branches, animal excrement and failing debris (Leaf litter, sap). The only acceptable reason for pruning would be a heath and safety concern.
Condition : 15 - The applicant is reminded that the crowns of the nearby trees including the Sycamores, Magnolia and London Planes to the north and west of the site, are not damaged during the construction of the extension and that the applicant accept tht no works will be undertaken in the future to prune back any of those trees.  Works to these trees will only be undertaken for health and safety reasons and not for any other domestic or commercial reason.
subdivision_of_building: Rear of ground and first floors.
